title: Wilf Gentzen
text: Wilf Gentzen (born 3 April 1963, in <a href="Melbourne">Melbourne</a>) is an <a href="Australians">Australian</a> <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="light%20welterweight">light welter</a>/<a href="welterweight">welterweight</a> <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> of the 1980s and '90s who won the Victoria (Australia) State welterweight title, Australian welterweight title, <a href="List%20of%20Commonwealth%20Boxing%20Council%20Champions%23welterweight">Commonwealth welterweight title</a>, and was a challenger for the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">World Boxing Council</a> (WBC) International light welterweight title against <a href="Tony%20Jones%20%28boxer%29">Tony Jones</a><a href="http%3A//boxrec.com/list_bouts.php%3Fhuman_id%3D4498%26amp%3Bcat%3Dboxer"></a>, his professional fighting weight varied from , i.e. <a href="light%20welterweight">light welterweight</a> to , i.e. <a href="welterweight">welterweight</a>.
